thread.title: Chicago’s 4-Year Record: Nobody Shot to Death in A Week
thread.title_full: Chicago’s 4-Year Record: Nobody Shot to Death in A Week

author: K. Campbell
title: Chicago’s 4-Year Record: Nobody Shot to Death in A Week
text:
Prior to Monday night, the city’s last fatal shooting had been reported on February 26 when James Morris was also shot while sitting in a vehicle. The 26-year-old later died at a hospital, according to police. 
In the meantime, 43 more people were shot, none of them fatally. 
The record-breaking streak came on the heels of another grim, gun-related record set in Chicago not too long ago. In 2016, nearly 800 homicides were reported, the most in over two decades. Advertisement - story continues below 
This year hasn’t looked much better, despite the recent streak, as there had already been 392 shooting incidents as of February 26, with 98 victims fatally wounded. 
In fact, the city has already experienced 104 homicides so far this year, according to the Chicago Tribune , including four stabbings and one incident of child abuse. 
For many cities, eight days without a fatal shooting wouldn’t be cause for celebration, but just another normal week. 
Unfortunately, Chicago’s anti-gun laws have made it harder for people to protect themselves from criminals, which is why the liberal city continues to have some of the highest crime and gun violence rates in the country. Advertisement - story continues below
